measurements.id: Purified Water , Flow meter No. FM-1010.

steps.description: Check the cleanliness of the reactor. Charge Purified Water (Lot-I) into the reactor.
Charge GP HCI into the reactor under stirring.
Stir for 20 to 30 minutes.
Charge CS Lye ( Lot-I ) from the receiver SSRC-1010 to the reactor below 30°C. Check for a clear solution
Charge Activated carbon slurry (Purified Water Lot-II + Activated carbon) into the reactor.
Stir for 20 to 30 minutes.
Check the cleanliness of the reactor. Filter the reaction mass through the filter setup (SSCF-1001,SSMF-1001&SSMF-1002). Initially re-circulate the mass for 10 to 15 minutes.
If found satisfactory, transfer the filtered mass to another clean reactor (GLRE 1014).
After completion of filtration flush the filter setup with Nitrogen pressure.
Charge Purified Water Lot-III into reactor.
After completion of filtration flush the filter setup with Nitrogen pressure.
Slowly adjust the mass pH to 7.0 to 7.5 with filtered CS Lye (Lot-II) from receiver SSRC-1004 below 40ºC. Note: Record the temperature every 30+ 5 min
Cool to below 5ºC.
Maintain for 30 minutes at 30° C to 40ºC.
Check the cleanliness of the Centrifuge. Load the Lot-I material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3
Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014. Vol : 100 L
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min. by using at speed knob position 3 Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)
Unload the material into a single poly lined HDPE container
Load the Lot-II material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3
Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014. Vol: 100 L
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min.by using at speed knob position 3 Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)
Unload the material into a single poly lined HDPE container.
Load the Lot-III material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3
Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014. Vol : 100 L
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min.by using at speed knob position 3 Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)
Unload the material into a single poly bag into a HDPE container.
Load the Lot-IV material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3
Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014. Vol : 100 L
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min.by using at speed knob position 3 Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)
Unload the material into a single poly bag into a HDPE container.
Load the Lot-V material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3
Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014. Vol : 100 L
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min.by using at speed knob position 3 Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)
Unload the material into single poly lined HDPE container.
Load the Lot-VI material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3
Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014. Vol : 100 L
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min.by using at speed knob position 3 Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)
Unload the material into single poly lined HDPE container.
Load the Lot-VII material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3
Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014. Vol : 100 L
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min.by using at speed knob position 3 Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT . 100 ppm)
Unload the material into single poly lined HDPE container.
Load the Lot-VIII material into the centrifuge at speed knob position 1
Spin dry the material for 15 to 30 min. by using centrifuge speed knob at position 3
Wash the material with chilled Purified water (Lot-IV) from receiver SSJRC-1005 by using speed knob at position 1 and collect the ML's into receiver SSRC-1014.Vol : 100 L
Spin dry the material for 30 to 45 min.by using at speed knob position 3 Check the sample for chloride content (Chlorides : NMT 100 ppm)
Unload the material into a single poly bag into a HDPE container.
Check the cleanliness of the reactor. Charge IPA (Lot-I) from receiver SSRC-1011 to reactor.
Charge Methanol from receiver SSRC-1012 to reactor.
Charge Purified Water (Lot-V) and stir for 15 to 30 minutes.
Charge the GP Tech material into the reactor through PCS under stirring.
Stir for 15 to 30 min.
Raise the temperature to 40°C to 45°C.
Maintain the temperature for 30 to 45 minutes an hour at 40°℃ to 45°C. Note; Record the temperature for every 10+5mintes.
Cool the reaction mass 0℃ to 5°C. Note: Record the temperature for every 30+5mintes.
Maintain for 30 to 45 minutes at 0°C to 5°C.
Check the cleanliness of the ANFD. Transfer the reaction mass from the reactor (GLRE-1015) to ANFD.
Filter the mass by applying Nitrogen pressure to ANFD until removing the MLR to the collection tank SSST-1005.
Wash the material with IPA (Lot-II) from the receiver SSRC-1011 to ANFD.
Stir for 15 to 30 mins.
Apply Nitrogen pressure for 3 to 5 hours. The ML's are collected into a collection tank SSST-1005 Record Nitrogen pressure for every 60+ 10 min.
Release Nitrogen pressure and apply Vacuum

Dry the material for 5 to 7 hours under vacuum. Note: SSANFD temperature should be below 45 ℃ and vacuum NLT 600 mmHg. Hot water temperature should be 50 to 60 ℃. Continue the vacuum drying till distillate is absent in view glass of the collection line .
Break the vacuum after completion of drying with nitrogen.
Cool the material to below 30°C. Unload the material into the single poly bag into cleaned HDPE containers.
Check the cleanliness of the SSRCVD & hopper. Charge material into SSRCVD. Cleaned/Uncleaned
Close the manhole and rotate for 10 to 15 minutes.
Stop the SSRCVD and unload the material into a single poly bag HDPE containers.
Check the cleanliness of the Sifter & ensure the integrity of sieve and magnet Cleaned / Uncleaned
steps.remarks: Integrity of Sieve & Magnet: Satisfactory/ Does not satisfactory

steps.description: Record tare weights of containers (HDPE/Fiber containers) including outer Black polythene bag and inner semi transparent LDPE bag).

Sieve the material through designated mesh into HDPE / Fiber containers containing outer Black polythene bag and inner semi transparent LDPE bag and adjust the weights by using calibrated weighing balance. Mesh No: 40 #

Check the integrity of the sieve and magnet of the Sifter after completion of sifting. If any damage is found, inform the Officer/HOD. If any foreign particles are found on the magnet, separate them; count its number and write details in the remarks column. Handover the particles in a self sealed cover to the concerned Officer / HOD. . Integrity of Sieve & Magnets: Satisfactory/ Does not satisfactory
Clean the outer surface of the containers with lint free cloth. Paste Internal Product labels on the packing containers.
Inform QC for sampling and complete analysis using the Finished Product Sample advice sheet.
After QC sampling, Secure the inner and outer polythene bags with a cable tie and seal all the containers with a green seal and transfer them to the FP storage area.
